definition: to pretend that everything is going well
powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Or it can be so sugarcoated that it becomes a meaningless exercise in management.
sentences.chinese: 或者它只是粉飾太平，一種毫無意義的管理實踐。

sentences.english: They don’t want it sugarcoated or whitewashed.
sentences.chinese: 他們不希望得到那些糖衣包裹的或粉飾太平的信息。

sentences.english: Advocating Petty Bourgeoisie in disguise whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 鼓吹小資情調是變相的粉飾太平。

definition: Jian Zoupianfeng, pseudonym of prolific modern novelist
the sword moves with side stroke (modern idiom)/fig. unexpected winning move/unconventional gambit
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: hard to tell if it's real or sham
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
the four great Chinese inventions: paper, printing, magnetic compass and gunpowder
